verses.text: The LORD spoke to Moses, saying,
verses.comment: Follows the standard introduction to a command from God.

verses.text: "Take Aaron and his sons with him, and the garments, the anointing oil, the bull of the sin offering, the two rams, and the basket of unleavened bread,
verses.comment: Lists all required items for the ordination.

verses.text: "And gather all the congregation at the entrance of the tent of meeting."
verses.comment: Follows the directive to assemble publicly for the ceremony.

verses.text: And Moses did as the LORD commanded him, and the congregation was assembled at the entrance of the tent of meeting.
verses.comment: Describes Moses's obedience and the people's assembly.

verses.text: Moses said to the congregation, "This is what the LORD has commanded to be done."
verses.comment: Verbally connects the ceremony to a direct command.

verses.text: And Moses brought Aaron and his sons and washed them with water.
verses.comment: Simple action, literal to original.

verses.text: He put the tunic on him and tied the sash around him, clothed him with the robe, and put the ephod on him. He fastened the skillfully woven waistband of the ephod around him, binding it to him with the band.
verses.comment: List of garments as per priestly ordination.

verses.text: He placed the breastpiece on him, and in the breastpiece he set the Urim and the Thummim.
verses.comment: Urim and Thummim transliterated as commonly done.

verses.text: He set the turban on his head, and on the turban, in front, he set the golden plate, the holy crown, as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.comment: Follows the Exodus instructions closely.

verses.text: Then Moses took the anointing oil and anointed the tabernacle and all that was in it, and consecrated them.
verses.comment: Anointing for dedication.

verses.text: He sprinkled some of it on the altar seven times, anointed the altar and all its utensils, and the basin and its stand, to consecrate them.
verses.comment: Altars and items are made holy.

verses.text: He poured some of the anointing oil on Aaron's head and anointed him to consecrate him.
verses.comment: Faithful rendering of the original.

verses.text: Then Moses brought Aaron's sons and clothed them with tunics, tied sashes around them, and bound caps on them, as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.comment: Dressing of the sons matches Exodus context.

verses.text: He brought the bull of the sin offering, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the head of the bull for the sin offering.
verses.comment: Laying hands signifies identification with the sacrifice.

verses.text: Moses slaughtered it and took the blood, and with his finger put it on the horns of the altar around it and purified the altar, and poured out the blood at the base of the altar and consecrated it to make atonement for it.
verses.comment: Standard atonement ritual language.

verses.text: He took all the fat that was on the entrails, the fatty lobe attached to the liver, and the two kidneys with their fat, and Moses burned them on the altar.
verses.comment: Details match sacrificial law.

verses.text: But the bull, its skin, its flesh, and its dung, he burned with fire outside the camp, as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.comment: Ritual removal of unclean portions.

verses.text: Then he presented the ram of the burnt offering, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the head of the ram.
verses.comment: Presentation of the ram as per ordination.

verses.text: Moses killed it and threw the blood against the sides of the altar all around.
verses.comment: Follows standard burnt offering procedures.

verses.text: He cut the ram into pieces, and Moses burned the head and the pieces and the fat.
verses.comment: Remains literal and close to original.

verses.text: He washed the entrails and the legs in water, and Moses burned the whole ram on the altar. It was a burnt offering, a pleasing aroma, a food offering for the LORD, as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.comment: Emphasizes the purpose and acceptance of the sacrifice.

verses.text: Then he presented the second ram, the ram of ordination, and Aaron and his sons laid their hands on the head of the ram.
verses.comment: Second ram unique to ordination ceremony.

verses.text: And Moses killed it and took some of its blood and put it on the lobe of Aaron's right ear, on the thumb of his right hand, and the big toe of his right foot.
verses.comment: Blood application to key body parts for consecration.

verses.text: He brought Aaron's sons, and Moses put some of the blood on the lobes of their right ears, on the thumbs of their right hands, and on the big toes of their right feet. Then Moses threw the rest of the blood against the sides of the altar all around.
verses.comment: Same ritual applied to Aaron's sons.

verses.text: He took the fat, the fat tail, all the fat that was on the entrails, the fatty lobe attached to the liver, and the two kidneys with their fat, and the right thigh.
verses.comment: Details of heave/ordination offering portions.

verses.text: And from the basket of unleavened bread that was before the LORD, he took one unleavened loaf, one loaf of oiled bread, and one wafer, and put them on the fat and on the right thigh.
verses.comment: The details match Exodus instructions.

verses.text: He put all these in the hands of Aaron and in the hands of his sons, and waved them as a wave offering before the LORD.
verses.comment: Wave offering gesture, keeping literal language.

verses.text: Then Moses took them from their hands and burned them on the altar with the burnt offering. This was an ordination offering, a pleasing aroma, a food offering for the LORD.
verses.comment: Maintains the concept of pleasing aroma.

verses.text: Moses took the breast and waved it as a wave offering before the LORD. It was Moses' portion of the ram of ordination, as the LORD commanded Moses.
verses.comment: Wave (or elevation) offering as per custom.

verses.text: Then Moses took some of the anointing oil and some of the blood from the altar and sprinkled it on Aaron and his garments, and on his sons and their garments. In this way he consecrated Aaron, his garments, and his sons and their garments with him.
verses.comment: Sprinkling with oil and blood for sanctification.

verses.text: And Moses said to Aaron and his sons, "Boil the flesh at the entrance of the tent of meeting, and eat it there with the bread that is in the basket of ordination offerings, as I commanded, saying, 'Aaron and his sons shall eat it.'"
verses.comment: The boiled flesh is the priestly meal.

verses.text: And what remains of the flesh and the bread you shall burn with fire.
verses.comment: Disposal of leftovers for purity.

verses.text: You shall not go outside the entrance of the tent of meeting for seven days, until the days of your ordination are complete, for it will take seven days to ordain you.
verses.comment: Seven-day period for priestly consecration.

verses.text: As has been done today, the LORD has commanded to be done to make atonement for you.
verses.comment: Summing up the purpose of the ceremony.

verses.text: At the entrance of the tent of meeting you shall stay day and night for seven days and keep the LORD's charge, so that you do not die, for this is what I have been commanded."
verses.comment: Emphasizes seriousness of priestly office.

verses.text: And Aaron and his sons did all the things that the LORD commanded by Moses.
verses.comment: Concludes their complete obedience.
